text: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

text: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Vidiu Platon

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: Copy-and-Paste was programmed by programmers for programmers actually.
author: Anonymous

text: Algorithm: Word used by programmers when they don't want to explain what they did.
author: Anonymous

text: Hardware: The parts of a computer system that can be kicked.
author: Jeff Pesis

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: Ruby is rubbish! PHP is phpantastic!
author: Nikita Popov

text: Coding is the easy part. Naming variables is the hard part.
author: Anonymous

text: If at first you don't succeed, call it version 1.0.
author: Anonymous

text: Programmer: A machine that turns coffee into code.
author: Anonymous

text: Computers are fast; programmers keep it slow.
author: Anonymous

text: When I wrote this code, only God and I knew how it worked. Now, only God knows!
author: Anonymous

text: A SQL query walks into a bar, walks up to two tables and asks, 'Can I join you?'
author: Anonymous

text: How many programmers does it take to change a light bulb? None. It's a hardware problem.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: Things aren't always #000000 and #FFFFFF
author: Anonymous

text: I simply wait for the cat to walk over the keyboard.
author: Charles Bukowski (Attributed)

text: My code’s so clean, you could eat off it.
author: Anonymous

text: While there's code, there's a bug.
author: Anonymous

text: Home is where the wifi connects automatically.
author: Anonymous

text: There is no place like 127.0.0.1
author: Anonymous

text: Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: A computer once beat me at chess, but it was no match for me at kick boxing.
author: Emo Philips

text: To err is human, but to really foul things up you need a computer.
author: Paul R. Ehrlich

text: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

text: Java is to JavaScript as ham is to hamster.
author: Jeremy Keith

text: The C Programming Language: A language which combines the flexibility of assembly language with the power of assembly language.
author: Anonymous

text: One man’s constant is another man’s variable.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Syntactic sugar causes cancer of the semi-colons.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg and Shneiderman

text: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than it is to agree on one.
author: Alan Perlis

text: Software is a gas; it expands to fill its container.
author: Nathan Myhrvold

text: There are only 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

text: Debugging: Removing the needles from the haystack, only to realize the haystack was the problem.
author: Anonymous

text: My code works. I don't know why. My code doesn't work. I don't know why.
author: Anonymous

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: The best programs are the ones you don't have to write.
author: Anonymous

text: Hardware eventually fails. Software eventually works.
author: Anonymous

text: Programmers are like magicians: they turn coffee into bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: There are two major products that come out of Berkeley: LSD and UNIX. We don’t believe this to be a coincidence.
author: Jeremy S. Anderson

text: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
author: Jamie Zawinski

text: In C++ it's harder to shoot yourself in the foot, but when you do, you blow off your whole leg.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: My favorite programming language is solder.
author: Anonymous

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

text: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: The Internet: 'Where men are men, women are men, and children are FBI agents.'
author: Anonymous

text: Computers do not make errors. What they do, they do on purpose.
author: Anonymous

text: The programmer is a device for converting caffeine into code.
author: Anonymous

text: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Anonymous

text: The only difference between a good programmer and a bad programmer is that the good programmer makes a mistake once.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

text: Documentation is like sex: when it's good, it's very, very good; and when it's bad, it's better than nothing.
author: Dick Brandon

text: There are only two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-one errors.
author: Phil Karlton

text: The three chief virtues of a programmer are: Laziness, Impatience and Hubris.
author: Larry Wall

text: My code has no bugs, only undocumented features.
author: Anonymous

text: It works on my machine.
author: Every Programmer Ever

text: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as you can, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: Any sufficiently advanced bug is indistinguishable from a feature.
author: Rich Kulawiec

text: Programmers are tools for converting specifications into bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: I like to optimize my procrastination.
author: Anonymous

text: I’m not anti-social. I’m just not user friendly.
author: Anonymous

text: I’m a hacker, not a cracker. I break systems for fun, not profit.
author: Anonymous

text: The programmer's brain is a magical place: data goes in, bugs come out.
author: Anonymous

text: If a program is useful, it will have to be changed. And if a program is useless, it will have to be changed.
author: Anonymous

text: What is a programmer's favorite place to hang out? Foo Bar.
author: Anonymous

text: There's no 'I' in 'team', but there is 'bug' in 'debug'.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers always mix up Halloween and Christmas? Because Oct 31 == Dec 25.
author: Anonymous

text: C++: an octopus made by nailing extra legs onto a dog.
author: Steve Mayhew

text: Software and cathedrals are much the same – first we build them, then we pray.
author: Anonymous

text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

text: How many programmers does it take to screw in a lightbulb? None, that's a hardware problem.
author: Anonymous

text: I don't have a life. I'm a programmer. I have deadlines.
author: Anonymous

text: The compiler is very patient. The debugger is very strict.
author: Anonymous

text: The only thing worse than a bug is a bug that works perfectly.
author: Anonymous

text: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

text: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: If you optimize everything, you will always be unhappy.
author: Donald Knuth

text: There's an old saying in programming: 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it.' It should be: 'If it ain't broke, don't touch it!'
author: Anonymous

text: Java programmers wear glasses because they don't C#.
author: Anonymous

text: I've been debugging for a week. I think I'm starting to get Stockholm syndrome.
author: Anonymous

text: If the code is self-documenting, why do they still pay me?
author: Anonymous

text: My job is to make the computer do what it would do anyway, but faster.
author: Anonymous

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing. And that you need to Google everything.
author: Socrates (adapted)

text: It's not a bug, it's an undocumented feature.
author: Anonymous

text: Why was the JavaScript developer sad? Because he didn't Node how to Express himself.
author: Anonymous

text: The programmer got stuck in the shower because the instructions said: Lather, Rinse, Repeat.
author: Anonymous

text: Programmer's wife: 'Go to the store and buy a loaf of bread. If they have eggs, buy a dozen.' Programmer returns with 12 loaves of bread.
author: Anonymous

text: There are 10 kinds of people in this world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm not lazy, I'm just on power-saving mode.
author: Anonymous

text: The computer is a great tool for quickly solving problems that you wouldn't have without it.
author: Anonymous

text: Computers make excellent and efficient servants, but I have no wish to serve under them.
author: Anonymous

text: The most effective debugging tool is still a rubber duck.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm not a product of my environment. I'm a product of my error messages.
author: Anonymous

text: A byte walks into a bar and asks for a beer. Bartender says, 'Sure, what can I get you?' Bartender gets him a beer. Bartender says, 'That'll be $5.' Bartender asks, 'You want a light beer?' Byte says, 'No, I'm a full byte.'
author: Anonymous

text: Why do Java developers wear glasses? Because they don't C#.
author: Anonymous

text: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

text: I'm not yelling, I'm just coding in all caps.
author: Anonymous

text: My keyboard has a coffee stain on it. It’s a feature, not a bug.
author: Anonymous

text: Software development is like playing poker: you bluff, you bet, and sometimes you go all-in on a bad hand.
author: Anonymous

text: The only thing that isn't debugging is writing the code. And that's already debugging.
author: Anonymous

text: I have a compiler in my head, but it's always giving me syntax errors.
author: Anonymous

text: The code you just wrote will be obsolete before you finish reading this.
author: Anonymous

text: My favorite programming snack is a bug. It's high in protein.
author: Anonymous

text: If at first you don't succeed, then try rewriting the entire system from scratch.
author: Anonymous

text: The only way to write bug-free code is to write no code at all.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm a minimalist. I only keep the bugs that are absolutely essential.
author: Anonymous

text: My code is like a fine wine: it gets better with age. And more bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: The hardest part of debugging is knowing when to give up and start over.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers hate nature? It has too many branches.
author: Anonymous

text: What do you call a programmer who never showers? A stack overflow.
author: Anonymous

text: There are two ways to write error-free programs; only the third one works.
author: Alan J. Perlis

text: The sooner you start to code, the longer it takes.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm not a product of my environment. I'm a product of my `.`gitignore` file.
author: Anonymous

text: Software development is a marathon, not a sprint... where you often forget to train and occasionally trip over your own feet.
author: Anonymous

text: If a bug is found before the product ships, it's a defect. If found after, it's a feature.
author: Anonymous

text: My therapist told me to embrace my flaws. So I added more bugs to my code.
author: Anonymous

text: The only constant in software development is change. And bugs.
author: Anonymous

text: I write code that even I can't understand a week later.
author: Anonymous

text: Programmers are the only professionals who are paid to solve problems that they themselves created.
author: Anonymous

text: Programming is 10% science, 20% ingenuity, and 70% getting the bugs out.
author: Anonymous

text: The definition of a good programmer: one who writes code that works, but only after extensive debugging.
author: Anonymous

text: What's a programmer's favorite type of music? Algorithms.
author: Anonymous

text: Why do programmers get confused between Christmas and Halloween? Because Oct 31 == Dec 25.
author: Anonymous

text: I'm a debugging wizard. I just make the bugs disappear (temporarily).
author: Anonymous

text: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it. And maybe a few compiler errors.
author: Jordan Belfort (adapted)

text: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along would destroy civilization.
author: Gerald Weinberg

text: Optimism is a strategy for making a better future. Unless you're a programmer, then it's a lie.
author: Noam Chomsky (adapted)

text: The definition of a project manager: someone who thinks nine women can make a baby in one month.
author: Fred Brooks (adapted)
